data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The Geographic Names Information System (GNIS) is the Federal and national standard for geographic nomenclature. The U.S. Geological Survey's National Geospatial Program developed the GNIS in support of the U.S. Board on Geographic Names as the official repository of domestic geographic names data, the official vehicle for geographic names use by all departments of the Federal Government, and the source for applying geographic names to Federal electronic and printed products.

data_standardortools_collection.name: GENC
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The GENC Standard specifies a profile of ISO 3166 codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions.

data_standardortools_collection.name: GraphML
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: An XML file format and language for describing graphs.

data_standardortools_collection.name: GIF
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A bitmap image format.

data_standardortools_collection.name: HDF5
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data. HDF5 is portable and is extensible, allowing applications to evolve in their use of HDF5. The HDF5 Technology suite includes tools and applications for managing, manipulating, viewing, and analyzing data in the HDF5 format.

data_standardortools_collection.name: HDMF
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data. HDF5 is portable and is extensible, allowing applications to evolve in their use of HDF5. The HDF5 Technology suite includes tools and applications for managing, manipulating, viewing, and analyzing data in the HDF5 format.

data_standardortools_collection.name: ISA-Tab
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: General-purpose ISA-Tab file format - an extensible, hierarchical structure that focuses on the description of the experimental metadata (i.e. sample characteristics, technology and measurement types, sample-to-data relationships).

data_standardortools_collection.name: ISO 3166
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The purpose of ISO 3166 is to define internationally recognized codes of letters and/or numbers that we can use when we refer to countries and their subdivisions. However, it does not define the names of countries – this information comes from United Nations sources (Terminology Bulletin Country Names and the Country and Region Codes for Statistical Use maintained by the United Nations Statistics Divisions).

data_standardortools_collection.name: ISO 8601
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A way of presenting dates and times that is clearly defined and understandable to both people and machines.

data_standardortools_collection.name: JPEG
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A method of lossy compression for digital images.

data_standardortools_collection.name: JSON-schema
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: JSON validation

data_standardortools_collection.name: KGX
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: linked knowledge

data_standardortools_collection.name: LinkML
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: LinkML is a flexible modeling language that allows you to author schemas in YAML that describe the structure of your data. Additionally, it is a framework for working with and validating data in a variety of formats (JSON, RDF, TSV), with generators for compiling LinkML schemas to other frameworks.

data_standardortools_collection.name: MathML
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A product of the W3C Math Working Group, MathML is a low-level specification for describing mathematics as a basis for machine to machine communication which provides a much needed foundation for the inclusion of mathematical expressions in Web pages. It is also important in publishing workflows for science and technology and wherever mathematics has to be handled by software.

data_standardortools_collection.name: xlsx
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Format used by Microsoft Excel spreadsheet software.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Model Cards
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Structured documentation detailing performance characteristics of machine learning models.

data_standardortools_collection.name: MP3
data_standardortools_collection.description: MPEG-1 Audio Layer 3 | MPEG-2 Audio Layer 3
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: MP3 (formally MPEG-1 Audio Layer III or MPEG-2 Audio Layer III) is a coding format for digital audio.

data_standardortools_collection.name: MPEG-4
data_standardortools_collection.description: MPEG-4 Part 14 digital multimedia container format
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A digital multimedia container format most commonly used to store video and audio, but it can also be used to store other data such as subtitles and still images. Like most modern container formats, it allows streaming over the Internet.

data_standardortools_collection.name: netCDF
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A standardized format for chromatographic data representation.

data_standardortools_collection.name: NNEF
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: An exchange format for neural network models produced using Torch, Caffe, TensorFlow, Theano, Chainer, Caffe2, PyTorch, or MXNet.

data_standardortools_collection.name: OMXML
data_standardortools_collection.description: OGC and ISO Observations and Measurements standard in XML
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: This standard specifies an XML implementation for the OGC and ISO Observations and Measurements (O&M) conceptual model (OGC Observations and Measurements v2.0 also published as ISO/DIS 19156), including a schema for Sampling Features. This encoding is an essential dependency for the OGC Sensor Observation Service (SOS) Interface Standard. More specifically, this standard defines XML schemas for observations, and for features involved in sampling when making observations. These provide document models for the exchange of information describing observation acts and their results, both within and between different scientific and technical communities.

data_standardortools_collection.name: OGG Speex
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: File format and bitstream encoding for for spoken content, targeted at a wide range of devices other than mobile phones.

data_standardortools_collection.name: ONNX
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: ONNX is an open format built to represent machine learning models.

data_standardortools_collection.name: OpenAPI
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Standard for describing program interfaces.

data_standardortools_collection.name: parquet
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Apache Parquet is a free and open-source column-oriented data storage format in the Apache Hadoop ecosystem.

data_standardortools_collection.name: PURL
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: PURLs are Web addresses or Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) that act as permanent identifiers in the face of a dynamic and changing Web infrastructure. Instead of resolving directly to Web resources (documents, data, services, people, etc.) PURLs provide a level of indirection that allows the underlying Web addresses of resources to change over time without negatively affecting systems that depend on them. This capability provides continuity of references to network resources that may migrate from machine to machine for business, social or technical reasons.

data_standardortools_collection.name: PDF
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A file format to present documents, including text formatting and images, in a manner independent of application software, hardware, and operating systems.

data_standardortools_collection.name: PNG
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A raster-graphics file format that supports lossless data compression.

data_standardortools_collection.name: PS
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A page description language.

data_standardortools_collection.name: PMML
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: PMML (Predictive Model Markup Language) uses XML to represent mining models. The structure of the models is described by an XML Schema. One or more mining models can be contained in a PMML document. A PMML document is an XML document with a root element of type PMML

data_standardortools_collection.name: protobuf
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Protocol Buffers (a.k.a., protobuf) are Google's language-neutral, platform-neutral, extensible mechanism for serializing structured data.

data_standardortools_collection.name: PROV
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The PROV Family of Documents defines a model, corresponding serializations and other supporting definitions to enable the inter-operable interchange of provenance information in heterogeneous environments such as the Web.

data_standardortools_collection.name: pickle
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Serialization format for a Python object structure. “Pickling” is the process whereby a Python object hierarchy is converted into a byte stream, and “unpickling” is the inverse operation, whereby a byte stream (from a binary file or bytes-like object) is converted back into an object hierarchy.

data_standardortools_collection.name: QuDEx
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The Qualitative Data Exchange Schema (QuDEx) allows users to discover, find, retrieve and cite complex qualitative data collections in context.

data_standardortools_collection.name: RDA 10 Things
data_standardortools_collection.description: RDA CURE-FAIR 10 Things for Curating Reproducible and FAIR Research
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A framework for implementing effective curation workflows for achieving greater FAIR-ness and long-term usability of research data and code.

data_standardortools_collection.name: RDFS
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: RDF Schema (RDFS) is the RDF vocabulary description language. RDFS defines classes and properties that may be used to describe classes, properties and other resources.

data_standardortools_collection.name: RIF-CS
data_standardortools_collection.description: Registry Interchange Format - Collections and Services schema
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The Registry Interchange Format - Collections and Services (RIF-CS) Schema was developed as a data interchange format for supporting the electronic exchange of collection and service descriptions. It organises information about collections and services into the format required by the ANDS Collections Registry.

data_standardortools_collection.name: RO-CRATE
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A community effort to establish a lightweight approach to packaging research data with their metadata. It is based on schema.org annotations in JSON-LD, and aims to make best-practice in formal metadata description accessible and practical for use in a wider variety of situations, from an individual researcher working with a folder of data, to large data-intensive computational research environments.

data_standardortools_collection.name: RDF
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: describe anything

data_standardortools_collection.name: Safetensors
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A new simple format for storing tensors safely (as opposed to pickle) and that is still fast (zero-copy).

data_standardortools_collection.name: SVG
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) Version 1.1, a modularized language for describing two-dimensional vector and mixed vector/raster graphics in XML.

data_standardortools_collection.name: SHACL
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A language for validating RDF graphs against a set of conditions. These conditions are provided as shapes and other constructs expressed in the form of an RDF graph. RDF graphs that are used in this manner are called shapes graphs in SHACL and the RDF graphs that are validated against a shapes graph are called data graphs. As SHACL shape graphs are used to validate that data graphs satisfy a set of conditions they can also be viewed as a description of the data graphs that do satisfy these conditions. Such descriptions may be used for a variety of purposes beside validation, including user interface building, code generation and data integration.

data_standardortools_collection.name: SGI
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A raster graphics file format.

data_standardortools_collection.name: SSSOM
data_standardortools_collection.description: Simple Standard for Sharing Ontological Mappings
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: SSSOM is a Simple Standard for Sharing Ontological Mappings, providing a TSV-based representation for ontology term mappings, a comprehensive set of standard metadata elements to describe mappings, and a standard translation between the TSV and the Web Ontology Language (OWL).

data_standardortools_collection.name: statismo
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Statismo defines a storage format (Statistical Image And Shape Models) based on HDF5, which includes all the information necessary to use the model, as well as meta-data about the model creation, which helps to make model building reproducible.

data_standardortools_collection.name: SDMX
data_standardortools_collection.description: Statistical Data and Metadata eXchange standard
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: SDMX is an initiative to foster standards for the exchange of statistical information.

data_standardortools_collection.name: STL
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: STL files describe only the surface geometry of a three-dimensional object without any representation of color, texture or other common CAD model attributes. The STL format specifies both ASCII and binary representations.

data_standardortools_collection.name: SDD
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The goal of the Structured Descriptive Data (SDD) standard is to allow capture, transport, caching and archiving of descriptive data in all the forms shown above, using a platform- and application-independent, international standard. Such a standard is crucial to enabling lossless porting of data between existing and future software platforms including identification, data-mining and analysis tools, and federated databases.

data_standardortools_collection.name: TIFF
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: An image file format for storing raster graphics images.

data_standardortools_collection.name: TAR
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A tar (tape archive) file format is an archive created by tar, a UNIX-based utility used to package files together for backup or distribution purposes. It contains multiple files (also known as a tarball) stored in an uncompressed format along with metadata about the archive. Tar files are not compressed archive files. They are often compressed with file compression utilities such as gzip or bzip2.

data_standardortools_collection.name: TAPIR
data_standardortools_collection.description: TDWG Access Protocol for Information Retrieval
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The TDWG Access Protocol for Information Retrieval (TAPIR) is a Web Service protocol and XML schema to perform queries across distributed databases of varied physical and logical structure. It was originally designed to be used by federated networks. TAPIR is intended for communication between applications, using HTTP as the transport mechanism. TAPIR's flexibility makes it suitable to both very simple service implementations where the provider only responds to a set of pre-defined queries, or more advanced implementations where the provider software can dynamically parse complex queries referencing output models supplied by the client.

data_standardortools_collection.name: UCUM
data_standardortools_collection.description: The Unified Code for Units of Measure
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A common syntax for communication of quantities and their units.

data_standardortools_collection.name: WAV
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Waveform Audio File Format (WAVE or WAV due to its filename extension is an audio file format standard.

data_standardortools_collection.name: OWL
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The Web Ontology Language (OWL) is a family of knowledge representation languages or ontology languages for authoring ontologies or knowledge bases. The languages are characterized by formal semantics and RDF/XML-based serializations for the Semantic Web. OWL is endorsed by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) and has attracted academic, medical and commercial interest. The OWL 2 Web Ontology Language, informally OWL 2, is an ontology language for the Semantic Web with formally defined meaning. OWL 2 ontologies provide classes, properties, individuals, and data values and are stored as Semantic Web documents. OWL 2 ontologies can be used along with information written in RDF, and OWL 2 ontologies themselves are primarily exchanged as RDF documents.

data_standardortools_collection.name: WDL
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The Workflow Description Language (WDL) is a way to specify data processing workflows with a human-readable and -writeable syntax. WDL makes it straightforward to define analysis tasks, chain them together in workflows, and parallelize their execution. The language makes common patterns simple to express, while also admitting uncommon or complicated behavior; and strives to achieve portability not only across execution platforms, but also different types of users. Whether one is an analyst, a programmer, an operator of a production system, or any other sort of user, WDL should be accessible and understandable.

data_standardortools_collection.name: XBM
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: X PixMap (XBM) is an image file format used by the X Window System. Replaced by XPM.

data_standardortools_collection.name: XPM
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: X PixMap (XPM) is an image file format used by the X Window System.

data_standardortools_collection.name: xarray
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: An open source project and Python package that introduces labels in the form of dimensions, coordinates, and attributes on top of raw NumPy-like arrays, which allows for more intuitive, more concise, and less error-prone user experience.

data_standardortools_collection.name: YAML
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A human-readable data-serialization language. It is commonly used for configuration files and in applications where data is being stored or transmitted.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Zarr
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A format for storage of large N-dimensional typed arrays. Has implementations in multiple programming languages.

data_standardortools_collection.name: ZIP
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: An archive file format that supports lossless data compression.

data_standardortools_collection.name: AdapterHub
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Adapter refers to a set of newly introduced weights, typically within the layers of a transformer model. Adapters provide an alternative to fully fine-tuning the model for each downstream task, while maintaining performance. AdapterHub builds on the HuggingFace transformers framework, requiring as little as two additional lines of code to train adapters for a downstream task.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Bioimage
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A community-driven, fully open resource where standardized pre-trained models can be shared, explored, tested, and downloaded for further adaptation or direct deployment in multiple end user-facing tools (e.g., ilastik, deepImageJ, QuPath, StarDist, ImJoy, ZeroCostDL4Mic, CSBDeep).

data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: machine learning models, with focus on language models and NLP

data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: OpenML is an open platform for sharing datasets, algorithms, and experiments

data_standardortools_collection.name: PyTorch Hub
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: machine learning models

data_standardortools_collection.name: TFHub
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: machine learning models

data_standardortools_collection.name: ASA/ANSI S3.20
data_standardortools_collection.description: Acoustical Society of America / American National Standards Institute S3.20
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Definitions for terms used in human bioacoustics.

data_standardortools_collection.name: ADO
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: concepts related to Alzheimer's Disease

data_standardortools_collection.name: ARO
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Antibiotic resistance genes and mutations

data_standardortools_collection.name: APOLLO_SV
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Terms and relations for interoperation between epidemic models and public health application software.

data_standardortools_collection.name: AIO

data_standardortools_collection.name: BCO
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Biodiversity data, including data on museum collections and environmental/metagenomic samples.

data_standardortools_collection.name: FBBI
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Sample preparation, visualization and imaging methods used in biomedical research.

data_standardortools_collection.name: BSPO
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Spatial concepts, anatomical axes, gradients, regions, planes, sides, and surfaces.

data_standardortools_collection.name: BTO

data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A new clinical database, ACRIMA, has been made publicly available, containing 705 labelled images. It is composed of 396 glaucomatous images and 309 normal images. Additionally, python scripts used to obtain the presented results are also available.

data_standardortools_collection.name: AESDD
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Speech dataset. ~500 utterances classified by emotion

data_standardortools_collection.name: Alliance ingest
data_standardortools_collection.description: Alliance of Genome Resources Knowledge Graph
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The Alliance of Genome Resources contains a subset of model organism data from member databases that is harmonized to the same model. This is the graph ingest of Alliance data prepared for loading into the Monarch Initiative graph resource.

data_standardortools_collection.name: AlphaFold DB
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: AlphaFold DB provides open access to over 200 million protein structure predictions to accelerate scientific research.

data_standardortools_collection.name: OCTAGON
data_standardortools_collection.description: Angiography by Optical Coherence Tomography segmentation dataset
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The OCTAGON dataset is a set of Angiography by Octical Coherence Tomography images (OCT-A) used to the segmentation of the Foveal Avascular Zone (FAZ). The dataset includes 144 healthy OCT-A images and 69 diabetic OCT-A images, divided into four groups, each one with 36 and about 17 OCT-A images, respectively.

data_standardortools_collection.name: AV Nicking
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 90 fundus images with annotations for retinal arteriovenous (AV) nicking.

data_standardortools_collection.name: AudioMNIST
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 30000 audio samples of spoken digits

data_standardortools_collection.name: Bgee
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Bgee is a database for retrieval and comparison of gene expression patterns across multiple animal species, produced from multiple data types (bulk RNA-Seq, single-cell RNA-Seq, Affymetrix, in situ hybridization, and EST data) and from multiple data sets (including GTEx data).

data_standardortools_collection.name: BioRED
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Biomedical text relation annotations and labels for novel findings

data_standardortools_collection.name: BioMediTech RPE
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 195 phase-contrast microscopy images that were divided into 16 subwindows and each subwindow labeled into 4 classes by two trained operators.

data_standardortools_collection.name: BioScope
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Biomedical texts annotated for negation, speculation and linguistic scope

data_standardortools_collection.name: CASIA Iris
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: More than 54,000 external iris images

data_standardortools_collection.name: CASIA Iris Subject Ageing
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: More than 26,000 external iris images

data_standardortools_collection.name: CATH
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A free, publicly available online resource that provides information on the evolutionary relationships of protein structural domains.

data_standardortools_collection.name: CRAFT
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Biomedical texts annotated for concepts and linguistic features

data_standardortools_collection.name: CHiME
data_standardortools_collection.description: Computational Hearing in Multisource Environments Dataset
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Recordings of 4 speakers in ~9000 recordings over 4 noisy locations.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Coswara
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Respiratory sounds and speech of healthy and COVID-19 positive individuals.

data_standardortools_collection.name: CORD-19
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Biomedical texts with focus on SARS-CoV-2

data_standardortools_collection.name: CREMA-D
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Speech dataset. 7,442 recordings from 91 actors.

data_standardortools_collection.name: dbCRID
data_standardortools_collection.description: Database of Chromosomal Rearrangements In Diseases
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Database of human chromosomal rearrangement (CR) events and their associated diseases. For each reported CR event, dbCRID documents the type of the event, the disease or symptoms associated, and—when possible—detailed information about the CR event including precise breakpoint positions, junction sequences, genes and gene regions disrupted and experimental techniques applied to discover/analyze the CR event.

data_standardortools_collection.name: DECIPHER
data_standardortools_collection.description: DatabasE of genomiC varIation and Phenotype in Humans using Ensembl Resources
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: DECIPHER is used by the clinical community to share and compare phenotypic and genotypic data. The DECIPHER database contains data from 44,062 patients who have given consent for broad data-sharing; DECIPHER also supports more limited sharing via consortia.

data_standardortools_collection.name: dbGaP
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) was developed to archive and distribute the data and results from studies that have investigated the interaction of genotype and phenotype in Humans.

data_standardortools_collection.name: DeepDRiD
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: In DeepDR (Deep Diabetic Retinopathy), the fundus images composed of two parts. One part is from the participants in the Shanghai Diabetic Complication Screening Project (SDCSP), Nicheng Diabetes Screening Project (NDSP), and Nationwide Screening for Complications of Diabetes (NSCD) between 2014 and 2017 for regular fundus images. The other part was captured by a retinal specialist at an Eye Clinic located in Department of Ophthalmology, Shanghai Jiao Tong University affiliated Sixth People’s Hospital, China between 2014 to 2017 for regular fundus images and between Jan 2019 to present for ultra-widefield retinal images. From the thousands of examinations available, we have extracted 2000 regular fundus images from 500 patients and 256 ultra-widefield images from another 128 patients to form our dataset.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Deeply
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Human nonverbal vocal sound dataset

data_standardortools_collection.name: DAPS
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 20 speakers reading 5 excerpts each from public domain books.

data_standardortools_collection.name: DRiDB
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The Diabetic Retinopathy Image Dataset (DRiDB) has been established to help scientists from around the world to test and develop new image processing methods for early diabetic retinopathy detection in retinal fundus images.

data_standardortools_collection.name: DRIONS-DB
data_standardortools_collection.description: Digital Retinal Images for Optic Nerve Segmentation DataBase
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The database consists of 110 colour digital retinal images. Initially, it were obtained 124 eye fundus images selected randomly from an eye fundus image base belonging to the Ophthalmology Service at Miguel Servet Hospital, Saragossa (Spain). From this initial image base, all those eye images (14 in total) that had some type of cataract (severe and moderate) were eliminated and, finally, was obtained the image base with 110 images.

data_standardortools_collection.name: DRIVE
data_standardortools_collection.description: Digital Retinal Images for Vessel Extraction dataset
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 40 fundus images; annotations for diabetic retinopathy

data_standardortools_collection.name: Drishti-GS
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A dataset of retinal images which include both normal and glaucomatous eyes and manual segmentations from multiple human experts.

data_standardortools_collection.name: eICU-CRD
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Deidentified, multimodal patient data from ICU stays

data_standardortools_collection.name: EmoSynth
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 144 audio files labelled by 40 listeners.

data_standardortools_collection.name: ESM Atlas
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: An open atlas of 617 million metagenomic protein structures.

data_standardortools_collection.name: ECOD
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A hierarchical classification of protein domains according to their evolutionary relationships. Only proteins with experimentally determined spatial structures from the PDB database are currently classified in ECOD.

data_standardortools_collection.name: FANTOM
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Ongoing transcriptome analysis project.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Duke OCT
data_standardortools_collection.description: Farsiu et al. Optical Coherence Tomography dataset
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Individual optical coherence tomography images and marking 38400 BScans from 269 age-related macular degeneration patients and 115 normal subjects, their ages, and their corresponding segmentation boundaries on a 5mm diameter centered at the fovea.

data_standardortools_collection.name: FSDD
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 4 speakers, 2,000 recordings, 50 of each digit per speaker.

data_standardortools_collection.name: G1020
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 1020 high resolution colour fundus images and provides ground truth annotations for glaucoma diagnosis, optic disc and optic cup segmentation, vertical cup-to-disc ratio, size of neuroretinal rim in inferior, superior, nasal and temporal quadrants, and bounding box location for optic disc.

data_standardortools_collection.name: GRCh38
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The goal of the GENCODE project is to identify and classify all gene features in the human and mouse genomes with high accuracy based on biological evidence, and to release these annotations for the benefit of biomedical research and genome interpretation.

data_standardortools_collection.name: GEMEP
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 10 actors portraying 10 states and 12 emotions

data_standardortools_collection.name: GIC
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A continuously updating, queryable, federated genomic data commons.

data_standardortools_collection.name: GTex
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The Genotype-Tissue Expression (GTEx) project is an ongoing effort to build a comprehensive public resource to study tissue-specific gene expression and regulation. Samples were collected from 54 non-diseased tissue sites across nearly 1000 individuals, primarily for molecular assays including WGS, WES, and RNA-Seq.

data_standardortools_collection.name: AudioSet
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: dataset of manually-annotated audio events

data_standardortools_collection.name: HCUP
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The Healthcare Cost and Utilization Project (HCUP) includes the largest collection of longitudinal hospital care data in the United States.

data_standardortools_collection.name: HRF
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The public database contains at the moment 15 images of healthy patients, 15 images of patients with diabetic retinopathy and 15 images of glaucomatous patients. Binary gold standard vessel segmentation images are available for each image. Also the masks determining field of view (FOV) are provided for particular datasets.

data_standardortools_collection.name: HPOA phenotype
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Annotations on Human Phenotype Ontology terms for Orphanet diseases.

data_standardortools_collection.name: HPOA genes to phenotype
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Annotations on Human Phenotype Ontology terms for genes.

data_standardortools_collection.name: HPOA phenotype to genes
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Annotations on Human Phenotype Ontology terms for genes.

data_standardortools_collection.name: HCA
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The Human Cell Atlas (HCA) is an international group of researchers using a combination of these new technologies to create cellular reference maps with the position, function and characteristics of every cell type in the human body.

data_standardortools_collection.name: HMDB
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A freely available electronic database containing detailed information about small molecule metabolites found in the human body. It is intended to be used for applications in metabolomics, clinical chemistry, biomarker discovery and general education. The database is designed to contain or link three kinds of data - 1) chemical data, 2) clinical data, and 3) molecular biology/biochemistry data.

data_standardortools_collection.name: HPA
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The Human Protein Atlas is a Swedish-based program initiated in 2003 with the aim to map all the human proteins in cells, tissues, and organs using an integration of various omics technologies, including antibody-based imaging, mass spectrometry-based proteomics, transcriptomics, and systems biology. All the data in the knowledge resource is open access to allow scientists both in academia and industry to freely access the data for exploration of the human proteome.

data_standardortools_collection.name: IDRiD
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Dataset constituting typical diabetic retinopathy lesions and also normal retinal structures annotated at a pixel level.

data_standardortools_collection.name: IEMOCAP
data_standardortools_collection.description: Interactive emotional dyadic motion capture database
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 12 hours of audiovisual data by 10 actors; 5 emotions.

data_standardortools_collection.name: InterPro
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: InterPro provides functional analysis of proteins by classifying them into families and predicting domains and important sites.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Libri-CSS
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Derived from LibriSpeech by concatenating the corpus utterances to simulate a conversation and capturing the audio replays with far-field microphones.

data_standardortools_collection.name: LibriMix
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Derived from LibriSpeech. Generated, noisy mixes of speech.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Librispeech
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A corpus of ~1000 hours of English speech derived from read audiobooks from the LibriVox project.

data_standardortools_collection.name: LJ Speech
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A public domain speech dataset consisting of 13,100 short audio clips of a single speaker reading passages from 7 non-fiction books, with transcriptions.

data_standardortools_collection.name: LGVF
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Longitudinal visual field data of 139 glaucoma patients.

data_standardortools_collection.name: MIDRC
data_standardortools_collection.description: Medical Imaging and Data Resource Center
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A linked-data commons that coordinates access to data and harmonizes data management activities at three critical stages - (1) intake, including curation, de-identification, abstraction, and quality assessment (2) annotation and labelling of images and other data using semi-automated approaches and (3) distributed access and query methods.

data_standardortools_collection.name: MIMIC
data_standardortools_collection.description: Medical Information Mart for Intensive Care
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Deidentified, multimodal patient data

data_standardortools_collection.name: Messidor
data_standardortools_collection.description: Methods to Evaluate Segmentation and Indexing Techniques in the field of Retinal Ophthalmology dataset
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The 1200 eye fundus color numerical images of the posterior pole of the Messidor database were acquired by 3 ophthalmologic departments.

data_standardortools_collection.name: MicroLib
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A collection of 3D microstructural datasets assembed using a single 2D input slice as training data.

data_standardortools_collection.name: MS-SNSD
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A noisy speech dataset that can scale to arbitrary sizes depending on the number of speakers, noise types, and Speech to Noise Ratio.

data_standardortools_collection.name: WFDB
data_standardortools_collection.description: MIMIC Waveform Database for Biomedical Signal Processing
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A large collection of physiological signals and measurements from patients in intensive care units, including electrocardiograms, photoplethysmograms, respiration, invasive and non-invasive blood pressure, and more. These measurements and signals are obtained directly from the bedside monitor, and provide a detailed view into the physiology of critically ill patients.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Common Voice
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Spoken text from public domain sources.

data_standardortools_collection.name: MSP-Podcast
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 100 hours by over 100 speakers.

data_standardortools_collection.name: MSP-IMPROV
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 20 sentences by 12 actors; 4 emotions, with video

data_standardortools_collection.name: MuSIC data
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Two central approaches for mapping cellular structure – protein fluorescent imaging and protein biophysical association – each generate extensive datasets but of distinct qualities and resolutions that are typically treated separately. The MuSIC map is designed to address this challenge, by integrating immunofluorescent images in the Human Protein Atlas with ongoing affinity purification experiments from the BioPlex resource. The result is a unified hierarchical map of eukaryotic cell architecture. In the MuSIC hierarchy, nodes represent systems and arrows indicate containment of the lower system by the upper. Node color indicates known (gold) or putative novel (purple) systems. The size of each circle is based on the number of proteins in the system. The relative height of each system in the layout is determined based on the predicted diameter of the system in MuSIC.

data_standardortools_collection.name: MELD
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Derived from EmotionLines. Includes more than 1400 dialogues and 13000 utterances from the Friends TV series.

data_standardortools_collection.name: NHANES
data_standardortools_collection.description: National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) is a program of studies designed to assess the health and nutritional status of adults and children in the United States. The survey is unique in that it combines interviews and physical examinations. NHANES is a major program of the National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS).

data_standardortools_collection.name: PCORNet Data
data_standardortools_collection.description: National Patient-Centered Clinical Research Network data
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Clinical data from 9 primary partners.

data_standardortools_collection.name: NISQA-Corpus
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 14k speech samples with simulated background noise and live degradation conditions.

data_standardortools_collection.name: NLM-Chem-BC7
data_standardortools_collection.description: NLM-Chem BioCreative VII Chemical Identification corpus
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 204 full-text PubMed Central (PMC) articles, fully annotated for chemical entities by 12 NLM indexers for both span (i.e. named entity recognition) and normalization (i.e. entity linking) using MeSH.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Noisy
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Clean and noisy parallel speech database. Also known as VBD, Voice Bank + DEMAND. Speech samples from VCTK dataset.

data_standardortools_collection.name: OARD
data_standardortools_collection.description: Open annotation for rare diseases dataset
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A real-world-data-derived resource with annotation for rare-disease-related phenotypes. This resource is derived from the EHRs of two academic health institutions containing more than 10 million individuals spanning wide age ranges and different disease subgroups. By leveraging ontology mapping and advanced natural-language-processing (NLP) methods, OARD automatically and efficiently extracts concepts for both rare diseases and their phenotypic traits from billing codes and lab tests as well as over 100 million clinical narratives.

data_standardortools_collection.name: OCTID
data_standardortools_collection.description: Optical Coherence Tomography Image Retinal Database
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: An open source Optical Coherence Tomography Image Database containing different retinal OCT images with different pathological conditions.

data_standardortools_collection.name: ORIGA-light
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 650 retinal images annotated by trained professionals from Singapore Eye Research Institute. A wide collection of image signs, critical for glaucoma diagnosis, are annotated.

data_standardortools_collection.name: PAPILA
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Dataset with fundus images and clinical data of both eyes of the same patient for glaucoma assessment

data_standardortools_collection.name: PD database
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Recordings from 20 Parkinson’s Disease patients and 20 healthy subjects.

data_standardortools_collection.name: PMC OA
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Biomedical texts

data_standardortools_collection.name: REFUGE
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 1200 fundus images with ground truth segmentations of the optic disc and optic cup, and clinical glaucoma labels.

data_standardortools_collection.name: RIGA
data_standardortools_collection.description: Retinal fundus Images for Glaucoma Analysis dataset
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 750 retinal fundus images.

data_standardortools_collection.name: RIM-ONE DL
data_standardortools_collection.description: Retinal IMage database for Optic Nerve Evaluation
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 313 retinographies from normal subjects and 172 retinographies from patients with glaucoma. All of these images have been assessed by two experts and include a manual segmentation of the disc and cup.

data_standardortools_collection.name: ROC
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Currently, we have released a first data set, aimed at CAD of microaneurysms and dot hemorrhages. These abnormalities are amongst the first signs of the presence of diabetic retinopathy.

data_standardortools_collection.name: RNAseqDB
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: We developed a pipeline that processes and unifies RNA-seq data from different studies. Using the pipeline, we have processed data from the GTEx and TCGA and have successfully corrected for study-specific biases, allowing comparative analysis across studies.

data_standardortools_collection.name: SEMAINE
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 95 dyadic conversations from 21 subjects. Each subject converses with another playing one of four characters with emotions; 5 FeelTrace annotations - activation, valence, dominance, power, intensity.

data_standardortools_collection.name: SemMedDB
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A repository of semantic predications (subject-predicate-object triples) extracted from the entire set of PubMed citations.

data_standardortools_collection.name: GigaSpeech
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 10,000 hours of transcribed audio

data_standardortools_collection.name: Sound Commander
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A database of free audio samples of single-word commands, English pronunciations.

data_standardortools_collection.name: SWC
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Text-aligned spoken Wikipedia articles.

data_standardortools_collection.name: DiaRetDb1
data_standardortools_collection.description: Standard Diabetic Retinopathy Database Calibration level 1 dataset
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 89 fundus images with segmentation and annotated for different diabetic retinopathies

data_standardortools_collection.name: SCOP
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The SCOP database, created by manual inspection and abetted by a battery of automated methods, aims to provide a detailed and comprehensive description of the structural and evolutionary relationships between all proteins whose structure is known.

data_standardortools_collection.name: STARE
data_standardortools_collection.description: STructured Analysis of the REtina dataset
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: ~400 raw images

data_standardortools_collection.name: SBP Mosiac
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Subbasal nerve plexus Mosaic images acquired in vivo using laser-scanning confocal microscopy of the cornea in healthy subjects and type 2 diabetes mellitus subjects of the same age. Mosaics represent wide-field images of the plexus incorporating 3D nerve path data projected onto a 2D plane.

data_standardortools_collection.name: SUPERFAMILY
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A database of structural and functional annotation for all proteins and genomes. The SUPERFAMILY annotation is based on a collection of hidden Markov models, which represent structural protein domains at the SCOP superfamily level. A superfamily groups together domains which have an evolutionary relationship. The annotation is produced by scanning protein sequences from over 3,200 completely sequenced genomes against the hidden Markov models.

data_standardortools_collection.name: SAVEE
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 4 male actors in 7 different emotions, 480 British English utterances in total, including video of speaker faces.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Tatoeba
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A database of sentences, translations, and spoken audio for use in language learning. This download contains spoken English recorded by their community.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Ted-LIUM
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Audio talks and their transcriptions available on the TED website.

data_standardortools_collection.name: TCGA
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA), a landmark cancer genomics program, molecularly characterized over 20,000 primary cancer and matched normal samples spanning 33 cancer types.

data_standardortools_collection.name: RAVDESS
data_standardortools_collection.description: The Ryerson Audio-Visual Database of Emotional Speech and Song
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Speech dataset. 7356 files; 24 professional actors vocalizing lexically-matched statements and songs in a neutral North American accent.

data_standardortools_collection.name: TIMIT
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Recordings of 630 speakers of eight major dialects of American English, each reading ten phonetically rich sentences. It includes time-aligned orthographic, phonetic and word transcriptions as well as a speech waveform file for each utterance.

data_standardortools_collection.name: TESS
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Speech dataset. 2800 recordings by 2 actresses.

data_standardortools_collection.name: VIVAE
data_standardortools_collection.description: Variably Intense Vocalizations of Affect and Emotion Corpus
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Human non-speech emotion vocalizations.

data_standardortools_collection.name: VOiCES
data_standardortools_collection.description: Voices Obscured in Complex Environmental Settings Dataset
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A speech dataset targeting acoustically challenging and reverberant environments with robust labels and truth data for transcription, denoising, and speaker identification.

data_standardortools_collection.name: VoxPopuli
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: 100K hours of unlabelled speech data for 23 languages, 1.8K hours of transcribed speech data for 16 languages, and 17.3K hours of speech-to-speech interpretation data for 16x15 directions.

data_standardortools_collection.name: WHODrug
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: WHODrug contains individual trade names, active ingredients and additional information such as marketing authorisation holder, country of sale, pharmaceutical form and strength. All related medications are linked using a structured WHODrug alphanumeric code, connecting trade names and variation of the ingredient with the active moiety of the ingredient.

data_standardortools_collection.name: WikiPathways
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: WikiPathways is a database of biological pathways maintained by and for the scientific community.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Gupta2021
data_standardortools_collection.description: A DICOM Standard Pipeline for Microscope Imaging Modalities
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: This paper proposed a pipeline for the integration of multiple microscopy imaging modalities into the PACS-DICOM universe, including the numerous metadata elements. A proof-of-concept system was developed, for validation purposes, and integrated with the Dicoogle open-source PACS, providing image storage, metadata indexing and visualization.

data_standardortools_collection.name: MukhiyaLamo2021
data_standardortools_collection.description: An HL7 FHIR and GraphQL approach for interoperability between heterogeneous Electronic Health Record systems
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: ...we offer an architecture that utilizes a resource server based on GraphQL and HL7 FHIR that establishes communication between two heterogeneous EHRs. This paper describes how the proposed architecture is implemented to achieve interoperability between two heterogeneous EHRs, HL7 FHIR and OpenMRS. The presented approach establishes secure communication between the EHRs and provides accurate mappings that enable timely health information exchange between EHRs.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Tapuria2018
data_standardortools_collection.description: Comparison and transformation between CDISC ODM and EN13606 EHR standards in connecting EHR data with clinical trial research data
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: This work investigates the mapping and data interoperability between healthcare and research standards - EN13606 used for the EHRs and the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Operational Data Model (CDISC ODM) used for clinical research.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Biderman2022
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: This datasheet describes the Pile, a 825 GiB dataset of human-authored text compiled by EleutherAI for use in large-scale language modeling. The Pile is comprised of 22 different text sources, ranging from original scrapes done for this project, to text data made available by the data owners, to third-party scrapes available online.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Kalen2021
data_standardortools_collection.description: Design and Implementation of the Pre-Clinical DICOM Standard in Multi-Cohort Murine Studies
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The small animal imaging Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) acquisition context structured report (SR) was developed to incorporate pre-clinical data in an established DICOM format for rapid queries and comparison of clinical and non-clinical datasets. Established terminologies (i.e., anesthesia, mouse model nomenclature, veterinary definitions, NCI Metathesaurus) were utilized to assist in defining terms implemented in pre-clinical imaging and new codes were added to integrate the specific small animal procedures and handling processes, such as housing, biosafety level, and pre-imaging rodent preparation.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Xiao2022
data_standardortools_collection.description: FHIR-Ontop-OMOP - Building clinical knowledge graphs in FHIR RDF with the OMOP Common data Model
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: We developed a system called FHIR-Ontop-OMOP to generate virtual clinical KGs from the OMOP relational databases. We leveraged an OMOP CDM-based Medical Information Mart for Intensive Care (MIMIC-III) data repository to evaluate the FHIR-Ontop-OMOP system in terms of the faithfulness of data transformation and the conformance of the generated CKGs to the FHIR RDF specification.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Murugan2021
data_standardortools_collection.description: Genomic considerations for FHIR; eMERGE implementation lessons
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The Electronic Medical Records and Genomics (eMERGE) Network’s Phase III program initially used a commercially developed XML message format for standardized and structured representation of genetic results for electronic health record (EHR) integration. In a desire to move towards a standard representation, the network created a new standardized format based upon Health Level Seven Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (HL7® FHIR®), to represent clinical genomics results. These new standards improve the utility of HL7® FHIR® as an international healthcare interoperability standard for management of genetic data from patients.

data_standardortools_collection.name: HAPI FHIR
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A complete implementation of the HL7 FHIR standard for healthcare interoperability in Java.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Bradwell2022
data_standardortools_collection.description: Harmonizing units and values of quantitative data elements in a very large nationally pooled electronic health record (EHR) dataset
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The National COVID Cohort Collaborative (N3C) table of laboratory measurement data—over 3.1 billion patient records and over 19 000 unique measurement concepts in the Observational Medical Outcomes Partnership (OMOP) common-data-model format from 55 data partners. We grouped ontologically similar OMOP concepts together for 52 variables relevant to COVID-19 research, and developed a unit-harmonization pipeline comprised of (1) selecting a canonical unit for each measurement variable, (2) arriving at a formula for conversion, (3) obtaining clinical review of each formula, (4) applying the formula to convert data values in each unit into the target canonical unit, and (5) removing any harmonized value that fell outside of accepted value ranges for the variable.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Bönisch2022
data_standardortools_collection.description: Harvesting metadata in clinical care - a crosswalk between FHIR, OMOP, CDISC and openEHR metadata
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: To overcome the hurdle of disparate data sources and repositories with heterogeneous data formats a metadata crosswalk was initiated, based on existing standards. FAIR Principles were included, as well as data format specifications. The metadata crosswalk is the foundation of data provision between a Medical Data Integration Center (MeDIC) and researchers, providing a selection of metadata information for research design and requests. Based on the crosswalk, metadata items were prioritized and categorized to demonstrate that not one single predefined standard meets all requirements of a MeDIC and only a maximum data set of metadata is suitable for use. The development of a convergence format including the maximum data set is the anticipated solution for an automated transformation of metadata in a MeDIC.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Baskaya2019
data_standardortools_collection.description: Health4Afrika - Implementing HL7 FHIR Based Interoperability
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: This paper provides insights into how mHealth4Afrika is leveraging HL7 FHIR to support standards-based data exchange and interoperability between Electronic Medical Records and DHIS2. This work is currently being validated in the field.

data_standardortools_collection.name: PereiraPintoJunior2022
data_standardortools_collection.description: Integrating real-world data from Brazil and Pakistan into the OMOP common data model and standardized health analytics framework to characterize COVID-19 in the Global South
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: COVID-19 data from 2 large countries in the Global South were harmonized and analyzed using a standardized health informatics framework developed by an international community of health informaticians.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Pasini2022
data_standardortools_collection.description: matRadiomics - A Novel and Complete Radiomics Framework, from Image Visualization to Predictive Model
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Using a single tool, i) biomedical images can be imported and inspected, ii) the target can be identified and segmented, iii) features can be extracted from the target, iv) reduced and selected, and v) used to build a predictive model using machine learning algorithms. As result, two different feature extractors can be chosen, a Matlab-based extractor, and the Pyradiomics extractor naturally integrated into matRadiomics.

data_standardortools_collection.name: PatientTM
data_standardortools_collection.description: Modelling patient trajectories using multimodal information
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: We propose a solution to model patient trajectories that combines different types of information (e.g. clinical text, standard codes) and considers the temporal aspect of clinical data. This solution leverages two different architectures - one supporting flexible sets of input features, to convert patient admissions into dense representations; and a second exploring extracted admission representations in a recurrent-based architecture, where patient trajectories are processed in sub-sequences using a sliding window mechanism.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Garbin2021
data_standardortools_collection.description: Structured dataset documentation - a datasheet for CheXpert
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Following the structured format of Datasheets for Datasets, this paper expands on the original CheXpert paper and other sources to show the critical role played by radiologists in the creation of reliable labels and to describe the different aspects of the dataset composition in detail. Such structured documentation intends to increase the awareness in the machine learning and medical communities of the strengths, applications, and evolution of CheXpert, thereby advancing the field of medical image analysis.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Kvak2022
data_standardortools_collection.description: Towards Clinical Practice - Design and Implementation of Convolutional Neural Network-Based Assistive Diagnosis System for COVID-19 Case Detection from Chest X-Ray Images
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: One of the critical tools for early detection and subsequent evaluation of the incidence of lung diseases is chest radiography. This study presents a real-world implementation of a convolutional neural network (CNN) based Carebot Covid app to detect COVID-19 from chest X-ray (CXR) images. Our proposed model takes the form of a simple and intuitive application. Used CNN can be deployed as a STOW-RS prediction endpoint for direct implementation into DICOM viewers.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Papez2022
data_standardortools_collection.description: Transforming and evaluating the UK Biobank to the OMOP Common Data Model for COVID-19 research and beyond
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: We converted UK Biobank data to OMOP CDM v. 5.3. We transformed participant research data on diseases collected at recruitment and electronic health records (EHR) from primary care, hospitalizations, cancer registrations, and mortality from providers in England, Scotland, and Wales. We performed syntactic and semantic validations and compared comorbidities and risk factors between source and transformed data.

data_standardortools_collection.name: bio.tools
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Registry of software tools, databases and services for bioinformatics and the life sciences.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Bioconductor
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The mission of the Bioconductor project is to develop, support, and disseminate free open source software that facilitates rigorous and reproducible analysis of data from current and emerging biological assays. We are dedicated to building a diverse, collaborative, and welcoming community of developers and data scientists.

data_standardortools_collection.name: BioPortal
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: An ontology registry.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Bioregistry
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A registry of prefixes and identifier formats used in biomedical data sets, knowledge bases, and ontologies.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Bridge2AI registry
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Standards, tools, reference implementations, and related resources.

data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: CDISC launched the CDISC Shared Health And Research Electronic library (SHARE) to provide the standards metadata in machine-readable formats to facilitate the automated management and implementation of the standards.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Database Commons
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A catalog of worldwide biological databases maintained by the China National Center for Bioinformation,

data_standardortools_collection.name: Dockstore
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A free and open source platform for sharing reusable and scalable analytical tools and workflows.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Fairsharing
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: standards and databases

data_standardortools_collection.name: LinkML registry
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: schemas and machine-actionable standards

data_standardortools_collection.name: NCI caDSR
data_standardortools_collection.description: National Cancer Institute Cancer Data Standards Repository
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Registry and repository for oncology research common data elements and forms.

data_standardortools_collection.name: NRDR
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The primary purpose of NRDR is to aid facilities with their quality improvement programs and efforts to improve patient care by comparing facility data to that of their region and the nation. A practice or facility may choose to participate in any or all registries as appropriate for their practice. When a facility joins more than one registry, the warehouse allows information to be shared across registries within the facility.

data_standardortools_collection.name: OBO Foundry
data_standardortools_collection.description: Open Biological and Biomedical Ontology Foundry
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Ontologies.

data_standardortools_collection.name: PwC
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A free and open resource with Machine Learning papers, code, datasets, methods and evaluation tables.

data_standardortools_collection.name: r3data
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: re3data is a global registry of research data repositories. The registry covers research data repositories from different academic disciplines. re3data presents repositories for the permanent storage and access of data sets to researchers, funding bodies, publishers and scholarly institutions. re3data aims to promote a culture of sharing, increased access and better visibility of research data.

data_standardortools_collection.name: 3DP Registry
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: The joint RSNA and American College of Radiology (ACR) 3D printing clinical data registry collects 3D printing data at the point of clinical care. With the goal of improving both patient care and characterizing resource utilization, the brand-new registry collects anonymized 3D printing case information, clinical indications and intended uses for printed models, source imaging, model construction techniques and effort, 3D printing techniques and effort, and the clinical impact of the models.

data_standardortools_collection.name: clinical-problem-standardization
data_standardortools_collection.description: A corpus-driven standardization framework for encoding clinical problems with HL7 FHIR
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A framework for transforming free-text problem descriptions into standardized Health Level 7 (HL7) Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) models.

data_standardortools_collection.name: ARES
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A Research Exploration System designed to improved the transparency of observational data research. ARES is an opinionated framework that delineates three levels of observational data assessment.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Aesara
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Aesara is a Python library that allows one to define, optimize, and efficiently evaluate mathematical expressions involving multi-dimensional arrays.

data_standardortools_collection.name: AWS
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Cloud computing platform.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Amundsen
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Amundsen is a data discovery and metadata engine for improving the productivity of data analysts, data scientists and engineers when interacting with data. It does that today by indexing data resources (tables, dashboards, streams, etc.) and powering a page-rank style search based on usage patterns (e.g. highly queried tables show up earlier than less queried tables).

data_standardortools_collection.name: Anduril
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Anduril is a workflow platform for analyzing large data sets. Anduril provides facilities for analyzing high-thoughput data in biomedical research, and the platform is fully extensible by third parties.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Apache Atlas
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Apache Atlas provides open metadata management and governance capabilities for organizations to build a catalog of their data assets, classify and govern these assets and provide collaboration capabilities around these data assets for data scientists, analysts and the data governance team.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Spark
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Apache Spark is a unified analytics engine for large-scale data processing. It provides high-level APIs in Java, Scala, Python and R, and an optimized engine that supports general execution graphs.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Taverna
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Taverna is a domain-independent suite of tools used to design and execute data-driven workflows.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Appyters
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Appyters extend the Jupyter Notebook language to support external, end-user configurable variables. Appyters can be considered a meta Jupyter Notebook language that is compatible with standard Jupyter Notebook execution.

data_standardortools_collection.name: ATHENA
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A resource of searchable and loadable standardized vocabularies.

data_standardortools_collection.name: ATLAS

Researchers can create cohorts by defining groups of people based on an exposure to a drug or diagnosis of a particular condition using healthcare claims data.

data_standardortools_collection.name: AtriumDB
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A database of continuously-recorded physiological waveform data and other associated clinical and medical device data. Also the platform for storage and retrieval of clinical waveform data.

data_standardortools_collection.name: ACHILLES
data_standardortools_collection.description: Automated Characterization of Health Information at Large-scale Longitudinal Evidence System
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Provides descriptive statistics on an OMOP CDM database.

data_standardortools_collection.name: balance
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A Python package for balancing biased data samples.

data_standardortools_collection.name: BigQuery
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A fully managed, serverless data warehouse that enables scalable analysis over petabytes of data. It is a Platform as a Service (PaaS) that supports querying using ANSI SQL.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Biopython
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Biopython is a set of freely available tools for biological computation written in Python by an international team of developers. It is a distributed collaborative effort to develop Python libraries and applications which address the needs of current and future work in bioinformatics. The source code is made available under the Biopython License, which is extremely liberal and compatible with almost every license in the world.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Biotite
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: This package bundles popular tasks in computational molecular biology into a uniform Python library.

data_standardortools_collection.name: BrainStat
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A toolbox for the statistical analysis and context decoding of neuroimaging data. It implements both univariate and multivariate linear models and interfaces with the BigBrain Atlas, Allen Human Brain Atlas and Nimare databases.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Cavatica
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A data analysis and sharing platform designed to accelerate discovery in a scalable, cloud-based compute environment where data, results, and workflows are shared among the world's research community. Developed by Seven Bridges and funded in-part by a grant from the National Institutes of Health (NIH) Common Fund, CAVATICA is continuously updated with new tools and datasets.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Celery

It’s a task queue with focus on real-time processing, while also supporting task scheduling.

data_standardortools_collection.name: CLiXO
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: An updated version of the CliXO (Clique eXtracted Ontology) algorithm for inferring gene ontology terms from pairwise gene similarity data.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Comet
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Platform for managing machine learning models.

data_standardortools_collection.name: CDAPS
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Performs multiscale community detection and functional enrichment for network analysis through a service-oriented architecture. These features are provided by integrating popular community detection algorithms and enrichment tools. All the algorithms and tools run remotely on a dedicated server.

data_standardortools_collection.name: CD-CLiXO
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Builds a CDAPS compatible community detection Docker image using CliXO.

data_standardortools_collection.name: CORAL
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A framework for rigorous self-validated data modeling and integrative, reproducible data analysis

data_standardortools_collection.name: CML library
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Continuous Machine Learning (CML) is an open-source library for implementing continuous integration & delivery (CI/CD) in machine learning projects. Use it to automate parts of your development workflow, including model training and evaluation, comparing ML experiments across your project history, and monitoring changing datasets.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Cromwell
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Cromwell is an open-source Workflow Management System for bioinformatics.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Cytoscape
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: An open source software platform for visualizing complex networks and integrating these with any type of attribute data.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Dagster
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Open source orchestration platform for the development, production, and observation of data assets.

data_standardortools_collection.name: DANCE
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A Python toolkit to support deep learning models for analyzing single-cell gene expression at scale.

data_standardortools_collection.name: DRS
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: generic interface to data repositories

data_standardortools_collection.name: DVC
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Open-source version control system for machine learning and data set management.

data_standardortools_collection.name: DataHub
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: An open-source metadata platform.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Datasette
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: A tool for exploring and publishing data. It helps people take data of any shape, analyze and explore it, and publish it as an interactive website and accompanying API.

data_standardortools_collection.name: DENDRO
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: An analysis method for scRNA-seq data that clusters single cells into genetically distinct subclones and reconstructs the phylogenetic tree relating the subclones.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Determined
data_standardortools_collection.purpose_detail: Determined is an open-source deep learning training platform.

data_standardortools_collection.name: Dicoogle
